page.title: 06MUNDOLE FARM West Forres
page.content: This farm covers an area of about 150 acres, and is mainly used for barley.By planting winter and spring barley the farmer is able to make better use of the land and is able to harvest at different times.There is no livestock kept although the owners keep horses for their own use.In the early times all the water for the farm was supplied from a large well.In recent years the farm has been developed as a leisure centre.There is a caravan park,with both residential and holiday caravans,chalets,a shop,a function room and a bar.During the summer months regular horse-riding events are held and in the winter the function room is used for bowling.During the war the land was used for the now defunct Forres Airfield.
